texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: I stumbled upon a helpful guide to securing an apache server via Reddit's  /r/netsec subreddit . Without further ado, here's a link to the guide:
texts.text: I stumbled upon a helpful guide to securing an apache server via Reddit's  /r/netsec subreddit . Without further ado, here's a link to the guide:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: [<RawText children='Apache web server hardening & security guide'>]
texts.text: [<RawText children='Apache web server hardening & security guide'>]

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The guide covers the simplest changes, like reducing ServerTokens output and eliminating indexes, all the way up through configuring mod_security and using the  SpiderLabs GitHub repository  to add additional rules.
texts.text: The guide covers the simplest changes, like reducing ServerTokens output and eliminating indexes, all the way up through configuring mod_security and using the  SpiderLabs GitHub repository  to add additional rules.

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: If you'd like a more in-depth post about installing mod_security, I'd recommend  this one from Tecmint .
texts.text: If you'd like a more in-depth post about installing mod_security, I'd recommend  this one from Tecmint .

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: Oh, and as always, don't forget about SELinux. :)
texts.text: Oh, and as always, don't forget about SELinux. :)

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: UPDATE:  Thanks to  @matrixtek  for mentioning  Mozilla's recommendations specific to TLS .
texts.text: UPDATE:  Thanks to  @matrixtek  for mentioning  Mozilla's recommendations specific to TLS .
